basic.description: An advanced seminar on collective bargaining law. Among the topics which may be covered are: the law of certification, collective bargaining, unfair labour practices, industrial conflict, and the job rights of strikers; the historical significance and current relevance of the tort law of industrial disputes; dispute resolution in essential services; and the law of internal union affairs. Other topics which meet the course objectives will be added or substituted, to accord with the experience or the research interests of students. (To be offered jointly with LAW-566.) Not offered 2010-2011.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Industrial Dispute Law
